What's happening: Elon
Musk confirmed that X will delete all heuristics from its recommendation system within six weeks. In other words, the familiar logic of likes, replies, and reposts that shaped Twitter for years is about to disappear.
In its place, Grok, the platform's in-house Al model, will read and watch more than one hundred million posts and videos every day to decide what users see. At the same time, X is testing a new interface that keeps users inside the app even when they open external links.

What's happening: Elon
Musk confirmed that X will delete all heuristics from its recommendation system within six weeks. In other words, the familiar logic of likes, replies, and reposts that shaped Twitter for years is about to disappear.
In its place, Grok, the platform's in-house Al model, will read and watch more than one hundred million posts and videos every day to decide what users see. At the same time, X is testing a new interface that keeps users inside the app even when they open external links.

📣 New Podcast! "The Quantum Suicide Machine: Proving Quantum Immortality Across the Multiverse's Parallel Universes" on @Spreaker #bigquestions #consciousness #cosmology #existential #hugheverett #immortality #manyworlds #mindblown #paralleluniverse #philosophy #physics #podcast #quantumsuicide

external.description:
What if you could never die? Not in this universe, anyway. What if, every time you faced certain death, your consciousness simply… switched to a parallel universe where you survived?

Welcome to the mind-bending world of the Quantum Suicide Machine, the most audacious thought experiment ever devised. This isn't just a philosophical game; it's a direct challenge to the nature of reality itself, born from the controversial Many-Worlds Interpretation of quantum mechanics. Join us as we unpack Hugh Everett's revolutionary idea that every possibility creates a new, branching universe. We'll explore the chilling concept of Quantum Immortality, which suggests your personal consciousness will always follow the path of survival, making you, from your own perspective, immortal.

But is it that simple? We dive headfirst into the fierce debate, pitting the "immortalists" against the "mortalists." We'll tackle the tough questions: Who are "you" if countless versions of you exist in a parallel universe? Does your consciousness thin out with every split? And what does any of this have to do with the fine-tuning of the universe and the Anthropic Principle?

This podcast is your ultimate guide to one of the most thrilling and controversial ideas in modern physics and philosophy. Whether you're a science buff or just someone who's ever pondered the great "what ifs," this journey will change the way you see your own existence.

Ready to question everything you thought you knew about life and death? Hit that subscribe button, share this episode with a friend who loves a good mind-melter, and join our community of thinkers as we explore the very edges of reality. Your journey into Quantum Immortality starts now!
external.title: The Quantum Suicide Machine: Proving Quantum Immortality Across the Multiverse's Parallel Universes

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "From 'I Am a Mistake' to 'I Made a Mistake': A Guide to Self-Forgiveness (When Your Brain Won't Let You)" on @Spreaker #emotionalhealing #guilt #healingjourney #impostersyndrome #innercritic #mentalhealth #mentalwellness #mindset #perfectionism #personalgrowth #podcast #selflove

external.description:
What's the difference between saying "I made a mistake" and believing "I am a mistake"? The answer is the key to unlocking your mental freedom.

We all experience shame. It's a healthy emotion that tells us when we've done something wrong. But what happens when that feeling mutates into something toxic—a constant, nagging voice that attacks your fundamental identity? This is toxic shame, and it's the secret source of so much of our anxiety and self-doubt.

In this episode, we're pulling back the curtain on this destructive emotion. We'll reveal the six signs of toxic shame that you might be experiencing every day, from crippling perfectionism and overthinking every mistake, to reacting poorly to criticism because it confirms your deepest fears. We'll explore how that harsh inner critic isn't actually your voice, but a learned response from past experiences.

This isn't about blaming yourself; it's about understanding the root cause. We’ll show you how to untangle these negative patterns by cultivating radical self-compassion and learning the art of self-forgiveness. This is your guide to unlearning the toxic beliefs that have been holding you back.

If you are ready to stop feeling fundamentally flawed and start embracing your authentic, imperfect self, you cannot afford to miss this. Subscribe and share this episode—it could be the first step in someone else's journey to emotional healing.
external.title: From 'I Am a Mistake' to 'I Made a Mistake': A Guide to Self-Forgiveness (When Your Brain Won't Let You)

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The DEATH of the Internet: How OpenAI's AI Agents Are KILLING Your Browser" on @Spreaker #agenticcommerce #ai #aiagents #artificialintelligence #automation #chatgpt #digitalfuture #digitaltransformation #futureoftheinternet #futureofwork #futuretech #innovation #machinelearning

external.description:
Is the internet you use every day about to die? OpenAI is building an army of AI Agents designed to replace your browser, and you're not ready for what comes next.

The internet is becoming flooded with AI-generated content, pushing us toward a bizarre future of "model collapse" where AI learns from its own garbage. But the real story isn't the junk—it's the revolution OpenAI is quietly engineering. Forget typing into a search bar; we're entering a new, agent-mediated digital world where intelligent AI agents do everything for you.

In this episode, we're taking you to the front lines of this transformation. We'll reveal OpenAI's new Agent Kit and show you how AI agents will soon automate complex workflows, from handling your customer service nightmares to booking your next vacation. We'll also explore how the integration of apps like Canva and Spotify directly into ChatGPT is just the beginning. With the new Agentic Commerce Protocol, instant e-commerce transactions will happen without you ever visiting a website.

This is the end of browsing as we know it. We're not just talking about a new app; we're talking about the fundamental rewiring of our digital landscape. Is this the ultimate convenience, or are we handing over the keys of the internet to a single company?

If you want to understand where the digital world is really going, you need to listen to this. Subscribe and share this episode to stay ahead of the curve. Your digital future is being written right now.
external.title: The DEATH of the Internet: How OpenAI's AI Agents Are KILLING Your Browser

My Linux machines do what I expect. My work laptop is a Windows machine that seems more like a curmudgeon that views me as its caretaker.

“It’s not on us, on you and me, to use AI ethically or responsibly. It’s on the companies to build safe, reliable, ethical products. If you can’t do that and still make money, you don’t deserve to make money.”

images.alt: Canada was caught, red handed, putting up a fraudulent advertisement on Ronald Reagan’s Speech on Tariffs. The Reagan Foundation said that they, “created an ad campaign using selective audio and video of President Ronald Reagan. The ad misrepresents the Presidential Radio Address,” and “did not seek nor receive permission to use and edit the remarks. The Ronald Reagan Presidential Foundation and Institute is reviewing its legal options in this matter.” The sole purpose of this FRAUD was Canada’s hope that the United States Supreme Court will come to their “rescue” on Tariffs that they have used for years to hurt the United States. Now the United States is able to defend itself against high and overbearing Canadian Tariffs (and those from the rest of the World as well!). Ronald Reagan LOVED Tariffs for purposes of National Security and the Economy, but Canada said he didn’t! Their Advertisement was to be taken down, IMMEDIATELY, but they let it run last night during the World Series, knowing that it was a FRAUD. Because of their serious misrepresentation of the facts, and hostile act, I am increasing the Tariff on Canada by 10% over and above what they are paying now. Thank you for your attention to this matter!

For instance, I think experiencing consciousness is likely an unfiltered ground-reality phenomenon - the system experiencing it is the experience. Experiencing the concept of "mass" is detached by ~1 more step but "atoms" or "anthropology" are detached by maybe ~2 more steps.

So interestingly, "being in a simulation" might be a continuous variable that depends on the number of steps that happen between phenomena existing and being registered - and for different phenomena the number of steps might be different!

If ChatGPT said "I am in a simulation" would it be correct?
I don't think there's a yes/no answer. If we analogize the GPT persona-generating process to the brain, then the prompts form the sensory input. In some ways, this input is in the "ground reality", in some ways it's not. 1/3
tl;dr: Gar nicht!

I guess the main question is, where is the boundary of helpful language polishing and unhelpful use of AI for academic writing. For me, this boundary is somewhere at the limit of capabilities of standard Word's grammar check or Grammarly's style check (or equivalent).

Polishing language for grammar/style or learning language structure is fine. But the use of ChatGPT for writing anything longer than a sentence may change logic, remove individuality and actually prevent active learning by writing. The latter is the most critical issue from educational perspective.

record.text: Very true. It seems the UK has got it wrong on all accounts. We pay a minimum wage AND the customer service is minimal. Don't get me wrong, I'm sure the Japanese will probably bitch about us the moment our backs are turned, but they're hardly painting roundabouts.

Eu só comecei a usar esses serviços com o notebook LM, exatamente pq é fechado nas fontes q eu passo. Esse lance dele sair catando informação da internet sem referência e sem garantia de qualidade me aflige, fora q a revisão piora muito.

I would love to buy salad and guac, for example - but I can't justify the cost to myself 

I can buy twice as much store-brand salsa in a jug for the cost of guac, and make 10 meals of pasta (5 boxes) for the price of a single salad kit 

I never buy fruit 

Potatoes and onions are the cheapest veg

Stores will squeeze you out of your wages so quick if you aren't careful about what you buy and that's 99% of why consumers feel like everything costs too much these days - they want to buy everything for every little impulse and convenience and you just can't be like that and have money left over.

record.text: I'm also a programmer, so I hate repetition and redundancy, and I love snippets and templates. Being able to just copy & paste what someone else already wrote, at the small cost of adding a note of attribution, is preferable to lazy me than getting into a topic from the beginning again, over & over.

For me, it's mostly about others, much more refinedly eloquent people than myself, being able to express exactly the things I've been thinking in much better words than I could ever find. I tend to ramble, but others get to the point more quickly, and often make it more accurately than I could. :)

Apple iOS 261 Set to Revolutionize Background Photo Uploads

Apple is preparing to tackle a long-standing frustration for iPhone users: the inability to upload photos to third-party apps in the background. With the upcoming iOS 26.1 update, users will no longer need to keep an app open to complete…

external.description: Apple is preparing to tackle a long-standing frustration for iPhone users: the inability to upload photos to third-party apps in the background. With the upcoming iOS 26.1 update, users will no longer need to keep an app open to complete uploads, a limitation that has plagued iPhone users for years. Until now, only Apple’s own Photos app could reliably back up images to the cloud while running in the background, leaving users tethered to progress bars and waiting anxiously for uploads to finish.
external.title: Apple iOS 261 Set to Revolutionize Background Photo Uploads

Hokkaido’s Hokuto City Launches Pioneering Disaster Drill Using Social Media Analysis

In a groundbreaking approach to disaster preparedness, Hokuto City in Hokkaido conducted its first-ever disaster drill, leveraging social media (SNS) analysis to enhance tsunami response strategies. The exercise,…

external.description: In a groundbreaking approach to disaster preparedness, Hokuto City in Hokkaido conducted its first-ever disaster drill, leveraging social media (SNS) analysis to enhance tsunami response strategies. The exercise, designed to simulate a massive earthquake along the Japan Trench and Kuril Trench, aimed to assess real-time damage and evacuation status through AI-powered analysis of residents’ social media posts. More than 300 participants, including local residents, firefighters, police, and Japan Ground Self-Defense Force personnel, joined forces to test this innovative approach.
external.title: Hokkaido’s Hokuto City Launches Pioneering Disaster Drill Using Social Media Analysis

record.bridgyOriginalText:
Sorting through video files and copilot is saying that I, Frankenstein has an Underworld connection, and I asked about it reflecting Prometheus the Created if Underworld is Werewolf and Vampire the Masquerade, and it's just given me:
* Constantine is MtA + Demon the Fallen
* The Covenant and The Craft are MtA
* Van Helsing is Hunter the Reckoning
and The Prophecy is DtF

hrm. Not a bad take

record.text: 📢 据警方称，在汉堡中央火车站发生的袭击事件中，有18人受伤，一些人伤势严重。一名39岁德国籍的女性嫌犯被逮捕。这是一周内德国发生的第三起持刀伤人事件，此前两起事件分别发生在德国西部城市的一家酒吧和柏林的一所小学。
